org.universAAL.ri.gateway.proxies.exporting

Class ProxyContextPublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.universAAL.middleware.bus.member.BusMember
      • org.universAAL.middleware.bus.member.Publisher
        • org.universAAL.middleware.context.ContextPublisher
          • org.universAAL.ri.gateway.proxies.exporting.ProxyContextPublisher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProxyBusMember

    public class ProxyContextPublisher
extends ContextPublisher
implements ProxyBusMember
    A ContextPublisher which will listen to remote ProxyContextSubscriber' messages and reinject them in to the local bus.
    All exported ContextSubscribers may be represented locally by the same ProxyContextPublisher.
    Author:
    amedrano

      • getBusMemberId

        public String getBusMemberId()
        Description copied from interface: ProxyBusMember
        Get the busmemberId.
        For imported proxies this ID of the internal busMember of the proxy.
        For exported proxies this ID is of the represented BusMember.
        Specified by:
        getBusMemberId in interface ProxyBusMember
        Returns:

      • addRemoteProxyReference

        public void addRemoteProxyReference(BusMemberReference remoteReference)
        Description copied from interface: ProxyBusMember
        Add a BusMemberReference to the proxy. This means that from this moment on the remote proxy and the local proxy can (and should) communicate with each other.
        A proxy may have more than one remote reference, each time the local proxy is to send a message it should send it to the whole list of remote proxies (list of references), provided for each the outgoing security checks per message is passed.
        Specified by:
        addRemoteProxyReference in interface ProxyBusMember
        Parameters:
        remoteReference - The reference to a remote proxy, its busmemberid and the session through which to find it.

      • removeRemoteProxyReference

        public void removeRemoteProxyReference(BusMemberReference remoteReference)
        Description copied from interface: ProxyBusMember
        Remove a concrete remote proxy. Does not send Remove message
        Specified by:
        removeRemoteProxyReference in interface ProxyBusMember
        Parameters:
        remoteReference - the remote's proxy reference to stop communicating with.

      • removeRemoteProxyReferences

        public void removeRemoteProxyReferences(Session session)
        Description copied from interface: ProxyBusMember
        Disconnect from all references that use the same session.Does not send Remove message
        Specified by:
        removeRemoteProxyReferences in interface ProxyBusMember
        Parameters:
        session - the session that is to be disconnected.

      • getRemoteProxiesReferences

        public Collection<BusMemberReference> getRemoteProxiesReferences()
        Description copied from interface: ProxyBusMember
        List all current references for this proxy.
        usually used to check the size, when the size of the set of references is 0 it means that the proxy should be closed and all Java-references so the object can be collected.
        Specified by:
        getRemoteProxiesReferences in interface ProxyBusMember
        Returns:
        the set of referneces.

        Specified by:
        getSubscriptionParameters in interface ProxyBusMember
        Returns:

      • handleMessage

        public void handleMessage(Session session,
                          WrappedBusMessage busMessage)
        Description copied from interface: ProxyBusMember
        When a session receives a WrappedBusMessage, it delivers it to the ProxyBusMember which its busMemberId matches the WrappedBusMessage's destination. The delivery is received through this method.
        Specified by:
        handleMessage in interface ProxyBusMember
        Parameters:
        session - the session through which the message was received.
        busMessage - the actual message received.

      • isCompatible

        public boolean isCompatible(Resource[] registrationParameters)
        As long as the registration parameters are ContextEventPattern, they will always match. This means there will be only one proxy exporter for all ContextSubscribers in the exported pool; since registration parameters changing is ignored there is no merging problem.
        Specified by:
        isCompatible in interface ProxyBusMember
        Returns:
        true if the proxy is compatible with the parameters.
